      void disposeAll()
      Disposes all assets.
      com.badlogic.gdx.assets.AssetManager getAssetManager()
      If you're only going to use AsserSorter for your asset management needs, then you will never ever need this method because AssetSorter does everything that you need to do with assetManager for you!
      However, I'm leaving this method in just in case you ever want to implement something on your own.

      • addImmediatelyNeededAsset

        public <T extends com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable> void addImmediatelyNeededAsset(java.lang.String assetKey,
                                                                                    T asset)
        Adds the specified immediately-needed-asset with the specified assetKey to it's inside.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of your asset
        Parameters:
        assetKey - key for your immediately-needed-assets asset
        asset - any immediately-needed-assets asset

      • addAsset

        public void addAsset(java.lang.String groupKey,
                     java.lang.String assetKey,
                     com.badlogic.gdx.assets.AssetDescriptor asset)
        Adds the specified to-be-loaded asset with the specified assetKey to the specified group. If this group doesn't exist, it will create it for you!
        Parameters:
        groupKey - key for your group
        assetKey - key for your to-be-loaded asset
        asset - any to-be-loaded asset

      • getResource

        public <T> T getResource(java.lang.String groupKey,
                         java.lang.String assetKey,
                         java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
        Use this method to get your to-be-loaded assets. You should call update(String) or update(String, int) to load some group before you get any assets from that group. Example: assetSorter.getResource("myFont", BitmapFont.class);
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the asset.
        Parameters:
        groupKey - key for your group.
        assetKey - key for your to-be-loaded asset.
        clazz - the class of your to-be-loaded asset.
        Returns:
        Your to-be-loaded asset.

      • getResource

        public <T extends com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable> T getResource(java.lang.String assetKey,
                                                                   java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
        Use this method to get your immediately-needed assets. Example: assetSorter.getResource("myFont", BitmapFont.class);
        Type Parameters:
        T - any type that extends/implements Disposable.
        Parameters:
        assetKey - key for your immediately-needed asset.
        clazz - the class of your immediately-needed asset.
        Returns:
        Your immediately-needed asset after it's casted into the specified class.

      • update

        public boolean update(java.lang.String groupKey,
                      int milliseconds)
        Starts/continues loading the specified group with milliseconds.

      • update

        public boolean update(java.lang.String groupKey)
        Starts/continues loading the specified group with milliseconds set to 17 which is the recommended value. Example: while(!game.assetSorter.update("GAME_SCREEN")){ float curProgress = game.assetSorter.getPercentage(); ... }

      • disposeAll

        public void disposeAll()
        Disposes all assets. (both to-be-loaded assets and immediately-needed assets)

      • getPercentage

        public float getPercentage()
        Returns:
        The current progress of the assetSorter (of all queued assets) as a float in range [0,1]

      • getAssetManager

        public com.badlogic.gdx.assets.AssetManager getAssetManager()
        If you're only going to use AsserSorter for your asset management needs, then you will never ever need this method because AssetSorter does everything that you need to do with assetManager for you!
        However, I'm leaving this method in just in case you ever want to implement something on your own.
        Returns:
        the assetManager wrapped inside this assetSorter
